comment.text:
I absolutely LOVED my dinner at Blue India. I had the fish moilee, medium spice level and it was so so good. Flavorful and just the right amount of spice (but I couldn't have done any more). My husband had the lamb curry and that was good as well, although the portion was smaller than my dish. We also had an order of garlic naan which came with 4 pieces. If you were really hungry you may want your own order of naan.

I would say service was adequate and the place itself is cute.

Parking: The validate parking for the garage attached to the building.

I went here on a Sunday night and it wasn't busy but still a decent amount of people. 

Service was great and the food was more than plentiful and filling. 

Can't wait to go back.

Atmosphere/parking: they validate 2 hours of parking in the attached garage, just be sure to ask before you leave. Lots of seating and you can see through the window in the kitchen them making the naan! Recommend making a reservation, can get busy. 
 
Food/price: we liked that they have options on here that aren't typically seen at other places. A bit pricey for the portion size. Group of 7 shared:
 
Masala Fries ($5): shoestring fries tossed in house spices serviced with house curry ranch and ketchup. Enjoyed the seasoning on the fries, pretty good portion size too for the price! The ranch was very tasty.
 
Juhu Beach Bhel ($8): puffed rice, sev, onions, potatoes, cilantro, tamarind chutney. Served cold, the puffed rice reminds of the rice krispy rice but more airy. It was a refreshing and interesting.
 
Saag Paneer ($17): spinach, cream, house spices, paneer; served with steamed basmati rice. We always order this any time we go to an Indian restaurant, can't really go wrong with this one!
 
Lamb Vindaloo ($21); braised in red wine vinegar with Kashmiri chilis, lamb; served with steamed basmati rice. Surprisingly, we didn't enjoy this as much. We asked for this spicy, wasn't as spicy as we thought it would be - the sauce tasted almost ketchup-y, maybe from the acid of the vinegar. There were quite a few chunks of potato in there, it was almost half the dish so not as many lamb pieces as expected.
 
Fish Moilee ($19): white fish in a Kerala-style fragrant coconut, coriander, and black pepper curry; served with rice. First time trying this and our group really liked it.
 
Chole Bhature ($16); Punjabi style chickpeas, corn kernels, served with fluffy fried leavened bread. Also a winner amongst the group. The fluffy bread tasted almost like the Native American fry bread which I really love and paired really well with the chole.
 
Saffron Butter Chicken ($19): cubed chicken thighs in a creamy-saffron butter sauce. We asked for this mild because we wanted one of the kids to be able to eat it. I think this would be better at a higher spice level because it is inherently sweet.
 
Garlic Naan ($6): garlic and cilantro, comes with 6 cut pieces. We had to order another basket to share amongst the 6 of us, it was very good though so can't complain.
 
TLDR: recommend garlic naan, fish moilee, saag paneer, chole bhature entrees!

Blue India was an absolute AMAZING experience. Furthermore, the restaurant is gorgeous and the ambiance is amazing!

It was my little brother's birthday and I wanted to try something new. Blue India has been on my list for a while as the reviews are very positive. I can honestly say that the reviews are true. The staff, the food, the environment, the aromas, everything as a whole is amazing. 

As it was a group of us we decided to get a selection of items on the menu. With this approach everyone was able to eat off of everything and get a feel for the overall selection of Blue India. 

It's no secret that I am a lover of Naan bread and babeeeeeeeeeee. Even though all the food selections were amazing, the Garlic Naan bread STOLE THE SHOW for me!!! I'm talking warm, soft, buttery, crispy edges, and a garlic profile that was spot on. I want moreeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!!!

As we were engaged in the fellowship of good times, great vibes, and great food, I was unable to take my pics as I normally do. However, what I will say to you is... Try Everything. LoL!!!!

I've only gotten takeout from Blue India but the staff is always friendly when I pick up. The yummy smell that comes from this place during business hours alone should make you want to try it! The food is fresh and tasty.

I've been trying many different Indian restaurants the last couple years and stumbled on this location. The food was quite delicious and portions are large. I ate off it for about 3 days. 

I ordered Tiki Masala, Kochi Beef Curry, Chili Salmon Bites, cheddar Naan and a ginger beer! I was happy to see the ginger beer from Jamaica! All items were delicious, very savory and just traditional Indian spices. So far the restaurants I've tried all taste very similar however I thought this location would be a tad unique when I saw British Indian. Next I have to try Tabla in Buckhead. 

My favorite was of course the Tiki Masala however the Kochi Beef was so tasty as well! I will order again from here for sure and recommend you to try as well!

After attending a show at the Fox Theater, my group and I visited this restaurant for dinner and were treated to an array of delightful dishes. The establishment maintained impeccable cleanliness and the staff provided exceptional service. Although we arrived later than planned, the waitstaff graciously accommodated us, allowing us to savor our meal unhurriedly, which was much appreciated. I opted for the vegan aloo gobi curry, and we started with the masala fries and samosa appetizers, both of which were delicious. Having resided in Atlanta for over 18 years, I can confidently say this is one of the finest Indian restaurants I've experienced, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit. The food here reminded me of my trip to London when I ate at a restaurant called the Bengal Clipper. The establishment is no longer but I was shocked at how accurate the British Indian restaurant, Blue India retained the familiarity and authenticity of Indian and English flavours.

Great place.  Great atmosphere and very friendly and CLASSY staff.  Oh, and the food, of course, excellent.   I had chicken biryani, spicy.  Be warned, the spicy is spicy, but still flavorful.  They have 5 degrees of spiciness to choose from.   I also had butter chicken, also great.  The naan selection is very tasty too.  Will definitely be back to try more.

photos.caption: Left to right,  butter chicken, chicken Biryani , Garlic Naan
Strawberry margarita without the extra garnishes unfortunately.

comment.text:
Pretty good good! I got the samosas, chicken tikka masala (mild) and plain naan. The samosas were awesome and the crust was salty in the best ways. The chicken tikka masala was good but really sweet, I didn't love it but I didn't hate it either. The plain naan was good but a lot thinner and crispier than I'm used to. I was expecting a more fluffy and chewy naan.

I went for lunch and ordered from the lunch menu but the portion size and price seem like they'd be the same for dinner.

Recently relocated from New York & was looking for some authentic Indian Food. This is the place! I've dined in and ordered takeout since my initial visit. As soon as you walk in you smelllll the food! There was a little wait but he reservations luckily so we were seated almost immediately. Service was great, ordered pretty quickly and the food did not disappoint. The ambiance is causal vibe. The coolest part is a glass window near the clay oven so you can watch naan and paratha etc being prepared. 


What we ordered;

Peshwari Naan 5/5 - Sweet, savory and baked to perfection.

Garlic Naan - 4/5 I thought it should have a little more garlic but good.

Lamb Tikka Masala  5/5- Tender, juicy & well seasoned.

Chicken Biryani - 4/5 Tasty, next time I'll add little more spice.

Samosa -4/5 Tasty but not as flaky as I like.
Paneer biryani takeout. I wish it was a little spicier but it was really good, I'll be back to try more.

Came back solo and enjoyed it even more. I ordered the chicken biryani with a side of butter sauce that goes with the the butter chicken. That combo is a game changer!!!!! I did not like the lamb shish kebab. Everything else was Delish!! Bartender was kind and gave me some great conversation. The beautiful Chef came out so I snapped a picture of her too. Thank You for the delicious dining.

Also they do cover your parking if you park in the garage and bring your ticket in.

As soon as you walk in, the smell hits you and it smells delicious. I knew the food was going to be amazing. It is really warm inside so no need to be bundled up, you'll be sweating. 

The service was pretty standard. We did have to ask for water a couple of times. When we asked an employee to take our picture, she politely declined. That was a first for me. 

The food was delicious. We got the samosas and fries. The fries came with curry ranch and that was a nice surprise. If you have two people ordering the same dish, you'll get one plate of rice to share. 

My friend got roti with his order and he was not a fan, so I recommend getting the garlic naan instead. I asked the server their favorite and they responded with the chicken tikka so I got that. Definitely did not disappoint. You can order the spice level you want for certain dishes. My palette isn't made for spicy anymore, but great options. 

I'm glad I tried this spot.

I've tried the food at Blue India a couple times now and it's honestly a pretty decent place to get Indian food. I'm a huge fan of the tikka masala, garlic naan, and chicken 65. Very flavorful, and delicious over rice. The garlic naan is buttery and garlicky, more soft than crispy. The samosas are a little starchy and dry for me so I might not get those again, I think they only have vegetable samosas here. They validate parking for 2 hours at the parking garage nearby which is super convenient. Service was good, food came out relatively quickly, and staff was great. It has a clean and modern vibe, overall nice establishment and would probably get Indian food from here again.
Amazing food and atmosphere for date night, night with friends or family. The service was great, they helped with the menu and were extremely attentive.

I really like this spot. The first time we went they were busy and we didn't want to wait for a table so we opted for the bar. The decor is phenomenal and it is fun and lively. Service is always good and the food is delish. The takeout is fabulous but go the restaurant and soak up the atmosphere. It's worth it 
Either way.

What a wonderful dining experience. My partner and I were craving Indian food and we read so many great reviews about Blue India so we decided to try it out. 

The food was absolute wonderful. We ordered quite a few things because we like to try as many things as possible and we really liked every single dish. What I especially liked was that we had options to order different spice levels. We both ordered the lowest level, but we realized we could've gotten the second level because the food wasn't spicy at all. 

Btw, there is an attached garage you can park at and get 2 hours validated by the restaurant if you give then your ticket!

I have come to Blue India twice now and both times it was equally amazing!! My one recommendation for something that we did not do was to get a reservation!! We definitely got lucky both times getting a table but on my 3rd time trying to go (key word: trying) the hostess was not pleased we didn't have a reservation and quoted 45 minutes but didn't seem sure about it lol

Either way, started our meal with some chicken 65 which is a classic appetizer! It tasted amazing and as expected and thoroughly enjoyed it. For my main, I got the chicken biryani with mild spice and omg. This container they gave me for the price was MASSIVE!!! Going forward, I plan to split it bc it is an absurdly huge thing of rice and tasted amazing and the spice was great and the chicken was so tender. My favorite thing. We always order a couple orders of naan, some garlic some plain and their naan is delicious! For the price, this place is high quality Indian food and they give a huge quantity. 10/10 for Indian food in midtown Atlanta

Did a bit of Yelping to find a good indian restaurant in downtown Atlanta and could not be more happy with this selection! We ordered a simple dinner with naan, two vegetable curries (saag and korma), rice and dal tadka. We asked for it to be spicy and it was SPICY! Everything was so good - felt like we were in NJ. Quantity was also perfect for five people. Prices are also like any other indian restaurants. We came an hour before closing and we were able to order everything we wanted (except dessert but that was also okay bc we were soo full from the food). The restaurant had good vibes and a great place to just sit and eat. Highly highly recommend when you're in the downtown Atlanta area!!

The service was great! I've had a lot of Indian, but this was my first time trying Karahi - soooooo good! I like the atmosphere and being able to see the tandoor ovens. I will go back for sure. The food is WAY better in person than from door dash.

Sucks! Seriously, I'm staying in a hotel in Atlanta and ordered delivery food and they included no utensils. When I called to ask why they said it's an option. As if delivering curry doesn't automatically infer that you might need some utensils. When did utensils, even plastics, become an option? You actually have to select?
And the food is so salty. I need a gallon of water just to get it down.  DO NOT !!!!
Tried to make the best of it but the food was so oily and gross I was scared to try continue for fear of spending the rest of the night on the toilet.
OMG -- the WORST Indian food I've ever had the displeasure of seeing.

photos.caption: Need I say more -- oils oozing everywhere' so grow and nasty.

comment.text: I'd vote Blue India is the best Indian food in Atlanta! The dal Makhani is outrageous along with the chicken tikka masala, butter chicken and lamb biryani plus cheddar naan! These are my greatest recommendations there although  I'm sure nothing would disappoint! I recommend making reservations and they validate your parking ticket at a local parking garage!

photos.caption: Chicken tikka Masala, dal makahani and lamb biryani

comment.text:
We were in Atlanta this weekend and stopped at this Indian restaurant after looking at the reviews. We ordered crispy bhindi fries, papdi chaat, malai kofta, peshavari naan and garlic naan. The flavors were to the point and exceeded our expectations for most of the items but didnt much care for the fresh lime soda and the peshavari Naan. Peshavari naan was very sweet, felt like I have having a dessert with kofta. Overall, I would give this place a 3.5 since I think they can do better with the cleanliness around, the bathrooms had slippery floors and cockroaches. I was scared to eat here after seeing the condition of the bathroom. We were happy with the flavors of the food but the food didn't sit well for both me and husband, we both had an upset stomach. 
The waitress was polite and gave us a free dessert for my bday

I hate to be a basic eater (always getting my favorite Indian dish) but the chicken tikka masala curry was so delicious! The garlic naan was spot on and I like that there were crispy pieces of onion on the rice which was different! To be a greedy person, I do wish there was more chicken in the curry but I'm still very happy with my dish. I picked this place for dinner and everyone liked their food so that was a success! The customer service was so amazing! They enjoyed my 3 month old who did so good during our time there (our server mentioned that to my mom while she waited for me to pull the car around). One of the workers even opened the car door for my mom so she could put my son's car seat in the car. That generosity will be remembered. I will definitely come back again and explore more of the menu and drink menu!

photos.caption: Chicken Tikka Masala Curry, Garlic Naan and Basmati Rice

comment.text:
Had a great time and most likely one of the best dining experience in all of Atlanta! .. delicious Indian food 

Chef Kartik is an extremely humble person at heart and is an absolute master of what he does. 

Great service and great staff, will surely return!

Had high hopes for this place based on other reviews but overall not impressed. Living in Atlanta, especially OTP I think we have gotten spoiled by the plethora of excellent, authentic and regional Indian restaurants serving tasty food at reasonable prices. The only reason we tried this place was because we had friends in town attending a conference downtown. I would only go here if you are restricted to the downtown/midtown area and Tabla is closed!  Service was fine, ambiance is a bit cramped, food was good but not great and they were out of several drinks we tried to order. In a pinch, it'll do or if you've never had Indian food - otherwise, go to Decatur or other suburbs for better and less expensive options.

Blue India offered solid Indian food, good variety, and thankfully, an open table without a reservation for a late Saturday night dinner. We shared papdi chaat, dal makhani, aloo gobi, garlic naan, and karahi chicken. It was definitely a little too much food for the two of us, but all of it was good. My favorites were the dal makhani and aloo gobi. Speedy service and good food overall.

photos.caption: Dal makhani, Aloo Gobi, karahi chicken

comment.text: Food is really good. The waiters are super nice. Very fast restaurant . I always eat chicken tikka masala and my husband has the chicken tandoori. Excellent recommendations

Tried this place out after hearing really great reviews from friends and it definitely lived up to the hype! Located in midtown by georgia tech, this place is spacious and offers 2 hour validated parking. The servers are quick and very polite. 

Garlic Naan: the best thing in my opinion! Classic, thin naan w light garlic. Hard to mess up, but delicious none the less. 5/5

Chicken 65: This was a breaded spicy chicken that was well marinated and flavored. This chicken did have a notable spice, but nothing crazy. 4/5

Chicken Tikka: Really good, creamy and served w basmati rice. You can choose your spice level on 1-5 and we have good spice tolerance but wanted to err on the side of caution and chose a 3 which wasn't spicy at all. Exactly what I wanted! 5/5
Best Indian food in ATL I've had yet. Their Biryani is soooo good. I'd pass on their butter chicken though.
Food was soooo good!! The service was great and the lighting was nice for a romantic date.

FOOD WAS AMAZINNGGG !! honestly the appetizers were just okay imo but the entrees are so good!!
the BEST part is the Naan. Get the Bullet naan and thank me later !
Other recommendations would be malai kofta and chicken korma!
The best Indian in town! Butter chicken to die for - my kids could eat in gallons. Vindaloo as apis y as it can be - excellent overall
It's good food. The only thing imma say is I ordered the spiciest level butter chicken and that thang was barely mild.

Great food, ambience, quick service 
Always a pleasure to eat and celebrate with family

I absolutely adored my time at Blue India! The food was a real treat, and our server was incredibly helpful with their recommendations. Just look at the picture-the portions were generous enough to feed all three of us, and we had plenty left for tomorrow's meal. We also had the Mango Dream and Passionate Dance drinks-they packed a punch! Definitely a good call to share with a friend. Counting down the days until my next trip to Atlanta for another trip here.

photos.caption: Chicken 65, Paneer Tikka, Garlic Naan, Malabar Paratha, Samosa Chaat, Malai Chicken Tikka

comment.text: My experience was not as expected, especially looking at reviews and Tik prior to ordering. I ordered food from here while at work, my originally Indian spot was closed on Wednesday. After I finally received my order I Began opening up everything that was nicely sealed. When I opened the first item it was extremely hard and it had a roach in the bottom of the box. Boy was I piss!! So not trying to discourage anyone if this is your go to spot. If this is your favorite restaurant then so bit it, continue. What's a little roach however just be mindful. I threw everything away that I ordered. With everything being so expensive nowadays, I don't play about my money. Period

We have walked by this place before and it smells wonderful so we were excited to try it out. The place is a bit trendy inside with dark decor, and you can see the two ovens used to make the breads which is a great feature. The breading for the samosas was firm not flaky and the filling was standard in terms of flavors. The masala fries were an interesting twist on an American classic. I was expecting to have curry filled with a plethora of spice so I was a little surprised to taste the curries and find it seemed a little flat, like it was missing a bit of coriander and/or cumin. Each was definitely mild, not spicy although I was never asked about spice level either. The curries were nicely blended and smooth. Service was okay, and they seemed to have enough servers for the customer base at the time we dined, which was Friday dinnertime. I did think the tables were too small because we had trouble with putting all the dishes on the table. It got worse when we packed up. I had to put some of the empties on the seat which is not ideal and I was lucky the table next to me was free. They also gave me a plastic bag instead of paper which they had available as I saw them give other people paper. So my items were a little unstable in my bag.

photos.caption: Saag - Paneer and Tikka Masala Curry - Chicken
Coconut Rice, Saag Curry and Tikka Masala Curry

comment.text:
Good food, good service and good ambience. 
Their drinks are also great. ( Just writing this in parenthesis to get to the minimum characters limit FML)

I have been to Blue India 3 times in last 4 months and have never been disappointed.  Being a former restaurant owner I can be very picky when it comes to indian restaurants. The dal, paneer preparations and the stuffed naans are amazing. Take spice levels very seriously and not like a typical Indian restaurant in US. 
I'll definitely be back

Went on a weekday in hopes to not run into any delays. I was quite wrong, along with being understaffed, they messed up my order hence got delayed even more. It was extremely cold inside the restaurant which was quite unpleasant. We did address our concern to the manager and they just kind of nodded it off. The food is definitely flavored according to the palate of non-indian people, hence a little bland and sweet. If you enjoy overpaying for mediocre indian food, be my guest!

This review is based upon delivered food, Uber Eats. Without question...this was the absolute most disgusting concoction of food I have ever....in all my years of global travel, ever seen much less tried to consume. It was utterly inedible, both orders of curry in their containers were under 2 solid inches of oil, the naan, if you can call it that was absolutely drenched in oil as well. Not sure what it's like dining in, but if this is what they put in the food, you may want to look elsewhere, or choose to have a VERY difficult next several hours. 
Additionally, if a delivery order is scheduled, put some eating utensils in the order, especially if delivered to a hotel. I can only imagine if they are cutting corners on a .25 plastic utensil how much they are cutting corners on the food, cleanliness and staff. One way or another, I list this as a never, ever again.

This is an absolutely delicious spot with a huge variety of quality Indian food. The service is proactive and friendly and you can go for anything from casual to upscale dining. But one of the absolute highlights is that they have two Tandoor ovens that you can see and watch them make anything from their huge naan and roti selection. This is a must-try!
Amazing....it was delicious, 10/10 recommend!!! The environment and amazing service is a plus as well

Decent food, the grilled chicken tika was amazing, moist and very flavorful. Probably the best I have ever eaten. The chicken tika masala was good. Fried okra was amazing. The raita was not as good as other places. The nan bread was tasty and fresh. Spinach sag paneer was tasty. The service was also good. 
There were many Indians there who typically are very critical. So ... this is a place that will not disappoint.

Spent 45 minutes waiting on a chicken appetizer of wings. And they wouldn't even cancel the order. Even that was an ordeal. The manager seriously needs some customer service training. And the waiter told us they were backed up with "to go" orders. Hint to restaurant: you should never tell a dining in customer that! People dining in are a priority and after 45 minutes of waiting...you should be ashamed. The other food we actually did receive was good. But the restaurant also doesn't seem to have heating and in the cold weather our food was a little cold. We froze our butts off while eating here. Won't be back! This place was good....i see the star count slowly going down. It's likely their service because the food is ok. Not the best in Atlanta but ok.

First time visiting ATL and this was our dinner our first night.  

Location and ambience are 100% . You're in the heart of Midtown and surrounded by a lot of art murals/structures. 

Walking in we were immediately greeted by the hostess and the amazing smells. The kitchen is pseudo open to the public via large glass window. 

We ordered the lamb vindaloo, chicken saag, mixed grill and garlic naan. All were extremely delicious and to our spice level (Indian hot).   The team there were so accommodating and attentive.  I make vindaloo at home and garlic naan often in my home and I must say theirs is absolutely delicious.   Too bad they're not in VA, we would frequent them often.

I've never had Indian food and was recommended this restaurant and let me tell you- I was NOT disappointed. Our waiter was very helpful in giving recommendations and we ended up with the classic tikka masala, saffron butter chicken, lamb kabobs, and karahi. Everything was delicious and you can choose the spice level which is great for wimps like myself. Overall great choice for a double date night !

Okay, so I said I wouldn't come back, but I ended up having an event here so I decided to give it another shot. I don't know if it was because I got takeout last time or the dish wasn't good or they just were having a bad day, but I ate in the restaurant this time and got the chicken biryani and it was absolutely delicious! I got 4/5 spice level and it was perfectly spicy. The rice was super flavorful. The servers were amazing and although the food was a little pricey, there was enough for a second meal! I take back what I originally said because I would come back here! Only for dine-in though since my takeout experience was not so good. There is also free 2 hour parking in the Metropolis deck
Great service , authentic environment, and food was amazing. Great for date night. One of the best Indian restaurants I've been to.
